result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:13 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm in court.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file.  ADA Becker states DE has another pending file in Branch IV, asking for another STC to review possible global resolution.  Atty White makes statements, Atty Dobbe is on other file. DE updates address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:15 AM. bph

records.addlTxt: Per SRN.  Faxed: Dispatch, Jail, & SCSO. bph

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, L.F.B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:45 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Michelle Brekken with Student Intern Alison Casey DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson for today Defendant Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm in court, in custody. Atty Harrelson didn't have an opportunity to meet with DE and doesn't know if DE qualifies for PD. Court advises DE to contact PD to qualify. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Court questions DE as to PD qualification. Atty Harrelson states DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument; DE states he didn't receive the summons. Atty Harrelson states DE turned himself in to the jail. Bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. QUASH WARRANT.  gll
